title: Would you be interested in seeing how Nikola Tesla developed a ‘free energy’ device? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nikola Tesla never developed a ‘free energy’ device. In Tesla’s day, electricity was mostly only available in cities. Farms and small rural communities didn’t have it, and wouldn’t have it until President Roosevelt’s Rural Electrification Administration set up hundreds of electrical cooperatives and developed high-voltage transmission systems that could move power more than a few miles. Tesla’s idea was to use the resonance of the earth to send electricity as “vibrations” that would be received by paying customers using some sort of a machine that would convert the vibrations into usable electricity. But what is the best proof that Tesla had no interest in free energy? Tesla’s Patent 455,068 is for an electric meter. A man who invented a device to help electric companies calculate customers’ bills is not a man who would be interested in giving electricity away!

Interested in seeing how he developed a non-existent device? No. Interested in seeing a genuine working free-energy device, sure. But so far all anyone has produced is words, claims, pseudoscience, etc. And strangely, all the promises fade away because of reasons like lack of investment, the scientific establishment hiding the truth, the Illuminati and giant lizards doing what they do, blah, blah.
